item.title: [HTB] Fawn
item.author: leewookb@gmail.com (Wook Lee)
item.description: Hopefully one day I will become very good at CTFs. TASK 1 What does the 3-letter acronym FTP stand for? File Transfer Protocol TASK 2 Which port does the FTP service listen on usually? 21 TASK 3 What acronym is used for the secure version of FTP? SFTP Secure File Transfer Protocol. Designed by the Internet Engineering Task Force as an extension of Secure Shell (SSH). TASK 4 What is the command we can use to send an ICMP echo request to test our connection to the target?
item.content:encoded:
Hopefully one day I will become very good at CTFs.

TASK 1

What does the 3-letter acronym FTP stand for?

File Transfer Protocol TASK 2

Which port does the FTP service listen on usually?

21 TASK 3

What acronym is used for the secure version of FTP?

SFTP Secure File Transfer Protocol. Designed by the Internet Engineering Task Force as an extension of Secure Shell (SSH).

TASK 4

What is the command we can use to send an ICMP echo request to test our connection to the target?

ping â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ ping 10.129.67.107 PING 10.129.67.107 (10.129.67.107) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from 10.129.67.107: icmp_seq=1 ttl=63 time=8.68 ms 64 bytes from 10.129.67.107: icmp_seq=2 ttl=63 time=8.81 ms 64 bytes from 10.129.67.107: icmp_seq=3 ttl=63 time=8.87 ms 64 bytes from 10.129.67.107: icmp_seq=4 ttl=63 time=8.68 ms ^C — 10.129.67.107 ping statistics — 4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3006ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 8.679/8.760/8.873/0.082 ms â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ TASK 5

From your scans, what version is FTP running on the target?

vsftpd 3.0.3 â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ nmap -sV 10.129.67.107 Starting Nmap 7.93 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2024-06-17 05:49 BST Nmap scan report for 10.129.67.107 Host is up (0.027s latency). Not shown: 999 closed tcp ports (conn-refused) PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 21/tcp open ftp vsftpd 3.0.3 Service Info: OS: Unix

Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://nmap.org/submit/ . Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 0.60 seconds â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ TASK 6

From your scans, what OS type is running on the target?

Unix TASK 7

What is the command we need to run in order to display the ‘ftp’ client help menu?

ftp -h TASK 8

What is username that is used over FTP when you want to log in without having an account?

anonymous â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ ftp 10.129.67.107 Connected to 10.129.67.107. 220 (vsFTPd 3.0.3) Name (10.129.67.107:root): anonymous 331 Please specify the password. Password: 230 Login successful. Remote system type is UNIX. Using binary mode to transfer files. ftp> TASK 9

What is the response code we get for the FTP message ‘Login successful’?

230 230 Login successful. TASK 10

There are a couple of commands we can use to list the files and directories available on the FTP server. One is dir. What is the other that is a common way to list files on a Linux system.

ls â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ ftp 10.129.67.107 Connected to 10.129.67.107. 220 (vsFTPd 3.0.3) Name (10.129.67.107:root): anonymous 331 Please specify the password. Password: 230 Login successful. Remote system type is UNIX. Using binary mode to transfer files. ftp> ls 200 PORT command successful. Consider using PASV. 150 Here comes the directory listing. -rw-r–r– 1 0 0 32 Jun 04 2021 flag.txt 226 Directory send OK. ftp> TASK 11

What is the command used to download the file we found on the FTP server?

get ftp> get flag.txt local: flag.txt remote: flag.txt 200 PORT command successful. Consider using PASV. 150 Opening BINARY mode data connection for flag.txt (32 bytes). 226 Transfer complete. 32 bytes received in 0.00 secs (32.7225 kB/s) ftp> SUBMIT THE FLAG

Submit root flag

035db21c881520061c53e0536e44f815 â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ ls Desktop flag.txt my_data Templates â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ cat flag.txt 035db21c881520061c53e0536e44f815 â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~] â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$

item.title: [HTB] Meow
item.author: leewookb@gmail.com (Wook Lee)
item.description: My journey begins here. ğŸŒ TASK 1 What does the acronym VM stand for? Virtual Machine TASK 2 What tool do we use to interact with the operating system in order to issue commands via the command line, such as the one to start our VPN connection? It’s also known as a console or shell. Terminal TASK 3 What service do we use to form our VPN connection into HTB labs?
item.content:encoded:
My journey begins here. ğŸŒ

TASK 1

What does the acronym VM stand for? 

Virtual Machine

TASK 2

What tool do we use to interact with the operating system in order to issue commands via the command line, such as the one to start our VPN connection? It’s also known as a console or shell.

Terminal

TASK 3

What service do we use to form our VPN connection into HTB labs?

openvpn

TASK 4

What tool do we use to test our connection to the target with an ICMP echo request?

ping

TASK 5

What is the name of the most common tool for finding open ports on a target?

nmap

TASK 6

What service do we identify on port23/tcp during our scans?

telnet
 1â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~]
 2â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ nmap -sC -sV 10.129.67.74 -p 23
 3Starting Nmap 7.93 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2024-06-17 05:20 BST
 4Nmap scan report for 10.129.67.74
 5Host is up (0.0098s latency).
 6
 7PORT   STATE SERVICE VERSION
 823/tcp open  telnet  Linux telnetd
 9Service Info: OS: Linux; CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel
10
11Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://nmap.org/submit/ .
12Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 20.48 seconds
13â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~]
14â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$

TASK 7

What username is able to log into target over telnet with a blank password?

root
 1â”Œâ”€[us-starting-point-vip-1-dhcp]â”€[10.10.14.27]â”€[leewookb@htb-psvucohdrg]â”€[~]
 2â””â”€â”€â•¼ [â˜…]$ telnet 10.129.67.74

 9  â–ˆ  â–ˆ â–ˆâ–„â–ˆ â–ˆâ–„â–„ â–â–ˆâ–€â–„    â–ˆ  â–ˆ â–ˆ â–ˆâ–„â–„    â–ˆâ–Œâ–„â–ˆ â–€â–„â–„â–€ â–ˆâ–€â–ˆ
